page.title: 08Travel in a London suburb
page.content: Our part of London is a commuter area. Tube trains from Wimbledon Park station run to London or Wimbledon every fifteen minutes and usually have four carriages.Now that smoking is banned they are much cleaner.The area also has the Southern Railway so it is easy to get to London to catch long-distance trains.Buses go along three main roads leading to London and often run late because of traffic jams in Wansworth and Wimbledon.Buses make me late for school so though most girls come in cars or buses I use my bike.It is a racer with five gears.I ride down side roads lined with cars but in one street the Council have cut pieces out of the pavement so that cars can park off the road.In the main road the lorries and cars spread fumes as they go past.Even so,bikes are the easiest way to travel.
